briefdescription.para: JSON parse failure or missing required fields.
Binary path unspecified and not inferable.
stat(2) failure or invalid file metadata.
Alias for older/newer code expecting OOM name.
Status codes returned by I/O and artifact-loading helpers.

detaileddescription.para:
All non-zero values indicate failure. The categories are stable and suitable for:
CLI diagnostics
benchmark harness error reporting
Implementations may set errno for OS-level failures, but this is not guaranteed for every failure mode.

briefdescription.para: Open and parse an IEBIN v1 model description.

detaileddescription.para:
On success:
out->loaded is set to non-zero,
JSON and BIN paths are resolved and stored,
basic metadata (dtype, version, size) is available for diagnostics.
Optional deduplication artifacts are opened if enabled via environment flags.

json_path
Path to model.ie.json (must be readable).
bin_path
Optional override for model.ie.bin; may be NULL.
out
Output descriptor (written on success).
IE_IO_OK on success, negative ie_io_status_t otherwise.
This function:
reads model.ie.json,
parses minimal metadata (version, dtype),
resolves the path to model.ie.bin using overrides and schema variants,
validates the weights binary size via stat(2),
optionally opens dedup artifacts when enabled.
In all error cases, the output structure is left in a safe-to-close state.

parameterdescription.para: Optional override for the binary path (may be NULL).

simplesect.para: IE_IO_OK on success; negative ie_io_status_t on failure.

briefdescription.para: Touch the weights binary to verify readability and warm OS caches.

detaileddescription.para:
Implementations perform small positional reads near the start and end of the file to:
detect permission or corruption issues early,
optionally fault pages into memory.
When deduplication is enabled, this also verifies the presence of auxiliary artifacts (defaults, exceptions, masks).

w
Opened weights descriptor.
IE_IO_OK on success, negative ie_io_status_t otherwise.
This performs small reads near the start and end of the binary. When dedup is enabled, also checks auxiliary dedup files.

simplesect.para: IE_IO_OK on success; negative ie_io_status_t on failure.

detaileddescription.para: This function releases any optional deduplication handles. It is idempotent and safe to call on zero-initialized or partially initialized descriptors.

w
Descriptor to close (may be NULL).
Close an opened weights descriptor.
This function is idempotent and safe to call on partially initialized structures. It does not unlink or delete any files; it only releases in-memory handles.

briefdescription.para: Load a vocabulary file or fall back to a stub.

detaileddescription.para: If vocab_path is NULL or unreadable, a deterministic stub vocabulary is provided to keep tests and benchmarks operational.

vocab_path
Optional path to vocabulary file.
out
Output vocabulary descriptor.
0 on success, negative on unrecoverable failure.
Load a vocabulary file or fall back to a stub.
This implementation does not parse a full tokenizer model. It only attempts a best-effort scan for a JSON-like field "vocabSize": <int> in the first few KB of the file.
If the file is missing/unreadable/unparsable, a deterministic stub value is returned to keep tests stable.

parameterdescription.para: Path to a vocabulary file (may be NULL or empty).

briefdescription.para: Encode UTF-8 text into token IDs (stub implementation).

detaileddescription.para:
This tokenizer:
splits on ASCII whitespace,
hashes tokens to stable integer IDs.
It is not compatible with BPE or HF tokenizers and must never be used for real inference.

v
Vocabulary descriptor.
text
NUL-terminated UTF-8 input.
ids
Output buffer, or NULL for size-only query.
out_count
In: capacity; Out: tokens written or required.
0 on success, negative on error.
Encode UTF-8 text into token IDs (stub implementation).
Tokenization rule: split on one or more ASCII whitespace characters. Empty tokens are never produced.

Size-only mode:
Pass ids == NULL to receive the required token count in out_count.

parameterdescription.para: Loaded vocabulary descriptor (unused by this implementation).
NUL-terminated UTF-8 string (must not be NULL).
Output buffer (or NULL for size query).
In: capacity of ids when ids != NULL. Out: number of tokens written (or needed when ids == NULL).

memberdef.argsstring: (const ie_vocab_t *v, const uint32_t *ids, uint32_t count, char *out, size_t out_sz)
memberdef.name: ie_tok_decode

briefdescription.para: Decode token IDs into a printable placeholder string.

detaileddescription.para: Produces a deterministic, human-readable representation for diagnostics.

v
Vocabulary descriptor.
ids
Token ID array.
count
Number of token IDs.
out
Output buffer.
out_sz
Output buffer capacity in bytes.
0 on success, negative on error.
Decode token IDs into a printable placeholder string.

Output format:
"T<ID0> T<ID1> ... T<IDn>" (space-separated)
This is intended for unit tests and harness debugging, not for real model text.

parameterdescription.para: Loaded vocabulary descriptor (unused by this implementation).
Array of token IDs (may be NULL when count == 0).
Capacity of out in bytes (must be > 0).
Output buffer too small or formatting truncated.

detaileddescription.para: Currently a no-op; present for API symmetry and future extensibility.

v
Vocabulary descriptor (may be NULL).
Release vocabulary resources.
This tokenizer implementation does not allocate dynamic resources for the vocab. This function is kept for API symmetry and future expansion.

briefdescription.para: Public I/O interfaces for model artifacts and lightweight tooling.

detaileddescription.para: This header defines the only stable public interface for:

listitem.para: Lightweight tokenizer / vocabulary helpers used by tests and harnesses
No heap ownership is exposed to callers.
All descriptors are POD structs suitable for stack allocation.

sect3.title: What this header deliberately does NOT provide

listitem.para: No tensor lookup by name (handled by tensor_map).

sect3.para: This file is part of Path 2 (real inference) but remains usable by diagnostic tools, benchmarks, and CI without CUDA or inference enabled.
